evalica - (12:03): why when I save the page all the attachments are being resaved and they increment as a minor version?  
evalica - (12:03): for a yesterday snapshot  
cjdelisle - (12:04): Looks like a bug. I made a change to attachment saving. Investigating...  
cjdelisle - (12:04): Thanks for pointing it out.  
evalica - (12:04): I have now for some attachments on a page version 1.111  
evalica - (12:05): and I can't save the page anymore because I get a NullPointerException  
evalica - (12:05): for saveAttachmentContent  
evalica - (12:05): thanks for looking ... so I have to work on a different snapshot :P  
cjdelisle - (12:06): Sorry about that. The patch was fixing the fact that attachments absolutely didn't work via xmlrpc or document.addAttachment.

cjdelisle - (15:17): Found the bug. doc.getDocument().getAttachmentList().get(0).isContentDirty() always returns true. My change just exposed it.  
evalica - (15:20): great you found it - that bug is not cool  
cjdelisle - (15:23): I'm glad you found it. it would have been a disaster to roll that out on myxwiki  
ennaoj joined #xwiki at 15:25  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 15:30  
abusenius - (15:35): is the flickr macro from macros.vm part of the removed flickr plugin?  
cjdelisle - (15:35): flicker macro doesn't use the flickr plugin.  
cjdelisle - (15:35): Odd I know.  
MartinCleaver joined #xwiki at 15:38  
abusenius - (15:43): is there some kind of rule when a bugfix should be backported to older version?  
cjdelisle - (15:45): I don't think it's hard and fast but I think the test is whether it's a major bug (eg: security) a regression and whether the fix is determined to be unlikely to cause any unforseen consequences.  
cjdelisle - (15:46): The most important (IMO) is the regression factor. If it's a bug that people have been living with then it seems silly to risk introducing instability to fix it.  
florinciu left at 15:46 (Quit: Leaving.  
abusenius - (15:47): well, srid stopped working in 2.4  
abusenius - (15:47): (partially)  
cjdelisle - (15:47): srid?  
abusenius - (15:47): restoring the request when you were logged out  
cjdelisle - (15:48): What's the effect?  
cjdelisle - (15:49): You always end up on the main page after logging in/out?  
abusenius - (15:49): well, if you were editing something and hit save when your session expired, you are redirected to login  
abusenius - (15:49): and your data is lost  
abusenius - (15:49): no  
abusenius - (15:50): I mean if you close the browser and your cookies are deleted or something  
cjdelisle - (15:50): Hmm. Maybe something to discuss on the list. Sounds serious. How dangerous is the patch?  
abusenius - (15:50): it adds srid to the xredirect url, shouldn'T break anything  
abusenius - (15:51): sergiu should know more, he wrote it afaik  
cjdelisle - (15:52): Srid is something I really know nothing about.  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 15:54  
cjdelisle - (15:59): I'd like to propose deprecating the old query plugin. What do people think?  
cjdelisle - (16:09): ouch. 9 methods in c.x.x.api.XWiki use the query "plugin"  
venkatesh left at 16:13 (Quit: Ex-Chat  
KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 16:19  
abusenius - (16:21): shouldn't platform/trunks/pom.xml have version 34-SNAPSHOT?  
cjdelisle - (16:39): Does anyone remember why XWikiDocument.copyAttachments calls newattachment.getAttachment\_content().setContentDirty(true);?  
cjdelisle - (16:40): copyAttachments is called by XWikiDocument.clone so in that application it's clearly wrong.

sburjan - (17:01): I've written the test  
sburjan - (17:01): should I send it now or tomorrow ?  
sdumitriu - (17:01): You can attach it to the issue on Jira  
sburjan - (17:02): okay  
venkatesh joined #xwiki at 17:02

sburjan - (17:08): sdumitriu, : done. I have one sugestion, we should a new line between the breadcrumb and WYSIWYG tab when editing sections  
sdumitriu - (17:08): Right

sburjan - (17:09): I've started to make a test for the issue regarding the mandatory title for documents  
sburjan - (17:09): tomorrow I'll finish it  
abusenius - (17:16): sdumitriu: hi, I found a bug in saved requests, XWIKI-5434  
abusenius - (17:18): it was introduced in 2.4, so imo the fix should be backported to 2.4, wdyt?  
sdumitriu - (17:21): Yep  
sburjan - (17:22): sdumitriu, : don't forgot to commit on 2.4.1 the bug about title  
sdumitriu - (17:23): Why on 2.4.1?  
sburjan - (17:24): well .. this issue is present on 2.4 .  
sburjan - (17:24): so we shouldfix it in 2.4 too  
sburjan - (17:25): Florin left a comment on the jira issue page

kaaloo joined #xwiki at 20:21  
kaaloo - (20:24): Hi xwikiers!  I was wondering if there was a known issue about using #includeMacros() in 2.4 (XWiki 2.0 Syntax).  
cjdelisle - (20:33): Yup.  
cjdelisle - (20:33): It's broken.  
cjdelisle - (20:34): the supported workaround is to use {{include document="The.Document" /}}  
lpereira left at 20:53 (Quit: Leaving.  
kaaloo - (21:06): cjdeslisle: yikes, so are you recommending not to upgrade to 2.4 before this is fixed ?  Because there could be a bunch of pages with mockups in them that use includeMacros().  
cjdelisle - (21:09): My recommendation is to complain on the mailing list.  
cjdelisle - (21:10): Also it would be helpful to open a bug on jira.xwiki.org  
cjdelisle - (21:11): From what I heard I gathered that the #includeMacros function is considered deprecated for syntax/2.0 usage.  
kaaloo - (21:18): cjdelisle: thanks, I'll do that  
kaaloo left #xwiki at 21:29
